page.title: 07Wood Norton Hall
page.content: Wood Norton Hall and it's extensive grounds are in the parish of Norton and Lenchwick approximately 2 miles west of Evesham.In the medieval peroid this area formed a part of the lands known as the Ford of Feckenham.This belonged to the king as a part of his demesne.The estate was owned by various families,yet still remained for hundreds of years one estate. In the mid-nineteenth century until 1872 it was owned by Edward Holland the last Liberal member of Parliament for Evesham.In 1872 the Wood Norton estate was purchased by the Duke d'Aumale.At this time it was a hunting lodge .He had infact occupied Wood Norton Hall since 1857 ,probably under lease.The estate was 4,000 acres, including Craycombe House,several farms,cottages,agricultural buildings, woodlands and the Avon fisheries.
